info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:42AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Davie, southeastern Iredell and northwestern Rowan Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 742 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Mocksville, or 4 miles north of Cleveland, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Mocksville, Salisbury, Spencer, Troutman, Bermuda Run, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Mooresville and High Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
